title: The Spartan 1 Mission
name: Spartan 1
alttext: photo of Spartan 1 in the shuttle bay
descript:
Spartan 1 was the first in NASA’s Spartan program based on the idea of a simple, low-cost platform deployed from a space shuttle in orbit for a 2–3 day flight, then recovered and returned to Earth. The platform allows the experiments to get out of the complex shuttle environment and frees it of any shuttle pointing constraints.

Spartan 1 was deployed from the Space Shuttle Discovery (STS-51G) on 20 June 1985 and retrieved 45.5 hours later.
features: Free flying instrument released from Space Shuttle and recovered a day and a half later

instruments.name: Spartan 1 X-ray Detectors
instruments.descript: The X-ray detectors aboard the Spartan platform scanned targets with narrowly collimated gas scintillation proportional counters. There were 2 identical sets of counters. Counts were accumulated for 0.812 s into 128 energy channels.

highlights: Observed the Perseus cluster of galaxies and galactic center region.
